name: Front Pull Wide
how_to_perform:
* Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, facing a pull-up bar.

* Grip the pull-up bar with an overhand grip that is slightly wider than shoulder-width.

* Keeping your arms straight, lean back and lift yourself up off the ground by squeezing your shoulder blades together.

* Pull the bar towards your chest, keeping your core engaged and avoiding swinging or jerking movements in your body.

* Engage your shoulders to control the movement of the pull-up bar as you bring it closer to your chest.

* Slowly release the tension by lowering yourself back down to a hanging position without any swinging motions.

* Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, focusing on squeezing your shoulder blades and engaging your core throughout the exercise.
short_summary: The front pull wide is a bodyweight arm-building exercise that utilizes multiple muscles in the upper body.
